name: Voicemaker
description: Voicemaker is an AI-powered text-to-speech platform offering over 1,000 natural-sounding voices in 130+ languages for creating professional audio content.
longDescription: Voicemaker is an AI-based text-to-speech converter designed to transform written text into lifelike audio, catering to content creators, businesses, and educators. Its mission is to simplify voiceover creation by providing customizable, high-quality AI voices for diverse applications like YouTube videos, podcasts, and e-learning materials. The platform supports over 130 languages and offers advanced features like voice cloning and emotional speech effects to enhance audio realism. By leveraging cutting-edge neural network technology, Voicemaker ensures natural-sounding output, making it accessible for users without technical expertise. It serves a global audience, with registered users from over 120 countries, and supports both free and premium plans for varied user needs.
features: Converts text to speech using over 1,000 AI voices in 130+ languages for versatile content creation.
Supports multiple audio formats like MP3, WAV, and OGG for compatibility with various platforms.
Offers customizable voice settings, including speed, pitch, volume, and pauses, to tailor audio output.
Provides voice cloning with Pro+ and Neural AI3 engines, creating ultra-realistic custom voices from 30-minute datasets.
Includes SSML support for advanced pronunciation control and realistic audio expressions.
Allows downloading of high-quality audio files (8,000Hz to 48,000Hz) for professional use.
Features a Pronunciation Editor for fine-tuning specific words, available with paid plans.
Enables users to retain full copyright of generated audio for commercial use, including YouTube and podcasts.
Offers a user-friendly interface with a dialogue box for instant text-to-speech conversion without tutorials.
Supports emotional voice styles like happy, sad, or conversational for engaging audio content.
Provides an API for developers to integrate text-to-speech functionality into applications.

faqs.question: What is Voicemaker used for?
faqs.answer: Voicemaker converts text into natural-sounding audio for applications like YouTube videos, podcasts, e-learning, and marketing content.

faqs.question: Is there a free plan available?
faqs.answer: Yes, Voicemaker offers a free plan with up to 250 characters per conversion and 100 weekly conversions, including access to 750+ voices.

faqs.question: Can I use Voicemaker audio for commercial purposes?
faqs.answer: Yes, subscribers own full copyright of generated audio and can use it for commercial purposes, such as YouTube or TikTok, without resale.

faqs.question: What languages does Voicemaker support?
faqs.answer: Voicemaker supports over 130 languages, including English, Spanish, Hindi, and Mandarin, with various regional accents.

faqs.question: How do I customize the voice output?
faqs.answer: Users can adjust voice speed, pitch, volume, and pauses via the editor and use SSML tags for advanced pronunciation control.

faqs.question: Does Voicemaker support voice cloning?
faqs.answer: Yes, paid plans offer voice cloning using Pro+ and Neural AI3 engines, requiring a 30-minute voice dataset.

faqs.question: What audio formats are available for download?
faqs.answer: Voicemaker allows downloading audio in MP3, WAV, and OGG formats with sample rates from 8,000Hz to 48,000Hz.

faqs.question: How many characters can I convert at once?
faqs.answer: The free plan allows 250 characters per conversion, while paid plans support up to 3,000 (Basic/Premium) or 10,000 (Business) characters.
